He uses the opportunity to engage in score-settling, pinning blame on others for the biggest foreign policy debacle in decades. In his worldview, the news media and authors who recounted George H.W. Bush 's term in office have distorted almost everything-including the timing of the decision to go to war in Iraq after the 9/11 attacks; the responsibility for holding, interrogating and prosecuting detainees in Guantanamo Bay; and even the handling of the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, Gwen Ifill writes in the Washington Post.
